availabilityZone.description: The AZ where the EBS volume will exist.

encrypted.description: If true, the disk will be encrypted.

finalSnapshot.description: If true, snapshot will be created before volume deletion. Any tags on the volume will be migrated to the snapshot. By default set to false

iops.description: The amount of IOPS to provision for the disk. Only valid for `type` of `io1`, `io2` or `gp3`.

kmsKeyId.description: The ARN for the KMS encryption key. When specifying `kms_key_id`, `encrypted` needs to be set to true. Note: The provider must be running with credentials which have the `GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext` permission on the specified KMS key as required by the [EBS KMS CMK volume provisioning process](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/services-ebs.html#ebs-cmk) to prevent a volume from being created and almost immediately deleted.

multiAttachEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable Amazon EBS Multi-Attach. Multi-Attach is supported on `io1` and `io2` volumes.

outpostArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

size.description: The size of the drive in GiBs.

snapshotId.description: A snapshot to base the EBS volume off of.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the resource. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

tagsAll.description: A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider `default_tags` configuration block.

throughput.description:
The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s. Only valid for `type` of `gp3`.

> **NOTE:** When changing the `size`, `iops` or `type` of an instance, there are [considerations](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/considerations.html) to be aware of.

type.description: The type of EBS volume. Can be `standard`, `gp2`, `gp3`, `io1`, `io2`, `sc1` or `st1` (Default: `gp2`).

availabilityZone.description: The AZ where the EBS volume will exist.

encrypted.description: If true, the disk will be encrypted.

finalSnapshot.description: If true, snapshot will be created before volume deletion. Any tags on the volume will be migrated to the snapshot. By default set to false

iops.description: The amount of IOPS to provision for the disk. Only valid for `type` of `io1`, `io2` or `gp3`.

kmsKeyId.description: The ARN for the KMS encryption key. When specifying `kms_key_id`, `encrypted` needs to be set to true. Note: The provider must be running with credentials which have the `GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext` permission on the specified KMS key as required by the [EBS KMS CMK volume provisioning process](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/services-ebs.html#ebs-cmk) to prevent a volume from being created and almost immediately deleted.

multiAttachEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable Amazon EBS Multi-Attach. Multi-Attach is supported on `io1` and `io2` volumes.

outpostArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

size.description: The size of the drive in GiBs.

snapshotId.description: A snapshot to base the EBS volume off of.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the resource. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

throughput.description:
The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s. Only valid for `type` of `gp3`.

> **NOTE:** When changing the `size`, `iops` or `type` of an instance, there are [considerations](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/considerations.html) to be aware of.
